channel.title: Posts on Emma Alexandria's Blog
channel.description: Recent content in Posts on Emma Alexandria's Blog

item.title: Rust is nice at programming
item.description: Rust is a language which is evangelised primarily for it’s safety. I’m going to be real here. I like writing safe programs, but I don’t really care that much. I was never a C or C++ developer. I did follow javid9x’s fantastic tutorials when I was younger, but my only real attempt to build something complex in either language was a sudoku solver which never worked because my code for drawing the board kept segfaulting.

item.title: The joy of a simple blog
item.description: Table of contents Readability The rule of stopping Technical simplicity Why do developers do this? In the spirit of the thesis of this blog post, I’m going to try and keep it short. Readability When it comes to the design of content-focused sites like blogs, there’s a idea I like to talk about that I call the HTML/CSS readability curve. HTML & CSS readability curve In my view, raw HTML is already very readable.
